name: Dmitri Mendeleev
description: Russian chemist, inventor of the periodic table, revolutionized atomic theory with his systematic organization of elements.

name: Henri Becquerel
description: French physicist, discovered radioactivity, awarded the Nobel Prize for his groundbreaking work on uranium and X-rays.

name: Thomas Edison
description: American inventor, responsible for the electric light bulb, phonograph, and advancements in motion picture technology.

name: Lynn Margulis
description: American biologist, known for groundbreaking endosymbiotic theory and contributions to evolutionary biology and microbiology.

name: Robert Hooke
description: English physicist, contributed to microscopy, formulated Hooke's Law, and made groundbreaking observations in 'Micrographia'.

name: Benjamin Franklin
description: American Founding Father and inventor, renowned for his experiments with electricity and the famous kite experiment.

name: Isaac Newton
description: English physicist and mathematician, formulated the laws of motion and universal gravitation, influencing classical mechanics.

name: Charles Darwin
description: British biologist, formulated the theory of natural selection, profoundly impacting biological sciences with 'The Origin of Species'.

name: Srinivasa Ramanujan
description: Indian mathematician, known for extraordinary contributions to number theory, infinite series, and continued fractions.

name: Johannes Kepler
description: German astronomer, formulated laws of planetary motion, fundamentally changing our understanding of celestial mechanics.

name: Max Planck
description: German physicist, father of quantum theory, known for contributions to atomic and subatomic processes.

name: Louis Pasteur
description: French microbiologist, pioneered germ theory, developed pasteurization, and created lifesaving vaccinations.

name: Alan Turing
description: British mathematician, pivotal in developing theoretical computer science, known for work on the Enigma machine.

name: Alfred Wegener
description: German meteorologist, proposed the theory of continental drift, greatly contributing to geosciences.

name: Barbara McClintock
description: American geneticist, discovered transposable elements in maize, advancing the field of genetics.

name: Stephen Hawking
description: British theoretical physicist, known for work on black holes and authoring 'A Brief History of Time'.

name: Werner Heisenberg
description: German physicist, formulated the uncertainty principle, impacting quantum mechanics.

name: Yang Zhenning
description: Chinese-American physicist, Nobel laureate, known for work in parity violation and quantum mechanics.

name: George Washington Carver
description: American agricultural chemist, revolutionized farming with innovations like crop rotation and peanut uses.

name: Carl Sagan
description: American astrophysicist, known for 'Cosmos' and contributions to the search for extraterrestrial life.
